case_title: ABDUL KARIM vs THE RETURNING OFFICER/AC, HUB AT. HUB and anothers
complaint_summary: Abdul Karim's nomination papers for election as Councillor from Ward No. 10, Town Committee Hub were rejected by the Returning Officer due to the absence of his seconder during scrutiny.
investigation_summary: The Returning Officer rejected the nomination papers citing the absence of the seconder, which was deemed mandatory. The Appellate Authority upheld this decision.
judgment_summary: The court ruled that the absence of seconder during scrutiny does not justify rejection of nomination papers as per Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983. Abdul Karim was declared a validly nominated candidate.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition accepted. Abdul Karim declared a validly nominated candidate.
legal_arguments: Defense argued that Rule 17(3)(b) of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983 does not mandate the presence of the seconder during scrutiny.
Prosecution contended that the presence of the seconder was necessary to verify authenticity of signatures.

legal_basis.constitution_article: Article 199 of the Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan, 1973

key_points.issue: Rejection of nomination papers due to absence of seconder during scrutiny.
key_points.decision: Absence of seconder is not mandatory under Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983.
key_points.directive: Returning Officer to include Abdul Karim's name in the list of validly nominated candidates.

statutes: Article 199 of the Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan, 1973
sections: Section 17(3)(b) of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983
Section 20 of the Balochistan Local Government Ordinance, 1980
key_issues: Whether the absence of the seconder during scrutiny invalidates nomination papers.
Interpretation of Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983.

maxims.may: In statutory interpretation, 'may' can imply 'shall' when the context mandates a duty.

legal_terms.scrutiny: Examination of nomination papers to ensure compliance with legal requirements.

words_and_phrases.mandatory: Required by law or rules; obligatory.
words_and_phrases.discretionary: Subject to individual judgment or choice.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the rejection of Abdul Karim's nomination papers due to the absence of his seconder during scrutiny. The court ruled that the presence of the seconder was not mandatory under Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983, and declared Abdul Karim a validly nominated candidate.
